text.sentence: Hey Mike,
What's up?
How are you, how's everything going.
Just wanted to catch up :-)
It's fine. :-)
I took a minor in Statistics.
You remember, I had one minor in Computational Science.
I took another in Statistics (it's 5 STAT courses - STAT 501, 505, 506, 557, and 463 - that I completed already).
Today I went to campus to get the minor form signed by Mitra ji, then I had to get it signed by STAT grad chair (Runze Li), then I submitted it to Kern building.
I met Sujatha in IST, and we had a chat.
Then on my way back, I met Juan and had a chat as well.
Looks like Juan is here for a week or something, to attend one of his friends' wedding.
He and his wife are doing well in Bogota. :-) :-)
I don't know if I told you about my defense. :)
Although I didn't need a thesis defense for M.E., I needed to submit and defend one paper.
So I defended the CICLING one. Dr Mitra agreed to be on the committee, and then he told me to get Wang-Chien Lee serve on the committee as well.
Fortunately, W.C. Lee agreed. This defense was done on last to last Thursday (May 24).
So now, my graduation requirements are finally over. :-) :-)
How are you doing ?
I heard that you went to Microsoft Redmond, right ?? :-)
Have a nice time :-) :-)
